intro: Argentina anserina subsp. egedii, commonly known as the Egedii water shield, is a aquatic plant native to South America. It is characterized by its floating leaves that are broadly ovate with a waxy surface. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species for wetland ecosystems.
